Really love SciShow and always appreciate the cool presentations but I think these types of reports pose a lot of danger to the wildlife involved. You get many people who will look at the title and not even listen to the science behind it but will feel "justified" to go hunting these animals in the hope it will "cure" their HIV/AIDS. Sangomas aka witch doctors here in Africa tell people to go out and kill certain animals and even people, to bring back to them so that they can make it into some sort of black magic medicine to cure their illness, which obviously does not work. People do many stupid things out of desperation and then we have another Rhino disaster etc going on. So I don't know how you guys are going to do it but I'm sure there are ways to report this without talking too much about how it's related to the poor seahorses which will intentionally get targeted by very stupid people looking for a cure themselves or getting lots of money to look for someone else.

For all the ppl that never look into the source papers of these videos:

The link between seahorse immunology and HIV research was proposed by the original authors of the paper, scishow only explained the background as to why they may have done that

There is in no way any direct treatment derived from this discovery. The only thing they describe is that seahorse immunology has gotten rid of big chunks of the MHC II pathways as well as show oddities in comparison with other vertebrates in their immunology in general. They hope to maybe use the seahorse as a model for HIV research (as it is apparently a lot less dependent on CD4/MHC II).
This doesn’t mean that there won’t be future associated discovery that may translate into a new form of treatment but as of now the only real ‘discovery’ is that vertebrate immunology can be more flexible than we originally thought.
